document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Macrophthalmus Desmarest, 1823 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Brachyura: Macrophthalmidae) from Taiwan, with notes on four new records

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Ilyograpsus paludicola (Rathbun, 1909)
, from Tainan, Taiwan. A–K, ♂ (CW 4.4 mm), NCHUZOOL 14772. A, carapace; B, palm of right chela; C, abdomen. D–K, right G1. D, ventral view; E, ventral view of terminal segment; F, dorsal view of terminal segment; G, outer view of terminal segment; H, inner view of terminal segment. I, ♀ (CW 5.6 mm), NCHUZOOL 14772, gonopore.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Taiwan :
1 ♂
(CW 4.4 mm ), 1 ♀ ( 5.6 mm ) (NCHUZOOL 14772 ), mangroves, Cigu River, Tainan, coll. J.-H. Lee,
10 Feb. 2003
.

Diagnosis. Carapace (
Fig. 1
A) suboctogonal. Postfrontal ridges distinct, crested, separated by broad median sulcus. Lateral margins convex, largest carapace width between third anterolateral teeth. Four or five anterolateral teeth present, first tooth (external orbital tooth) largest, triangular, acute or subacute; second tooth extending as far as or slightly exceeding first tooth, rounded or bluntly triangular; third tooth clearly exceeding beyond first tooth; fourth tooth small, but clearly delineated, subacute; fifth tooth conspicuously small. G 1 (
Fig. 1
D–H) with apical chitinous process long, inclined slightly. Female gonopore with oval operculum (
Fig.
1
I), directed mesially; shallow depression on sternite mesial to operculum.
Distribution. Taiwan , Pakistan , Vietnam , Malaysia , Singapore , Indonesia (Bintan, Sumatra, Bali, Papua ), Australia (Northern Territory), and New Caledonia .
Remarks. This is the first record of the subfamily Ilyograpsinae from Taiwan .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2 .
Ilyograpsus paludicola (Rathbun, 1909)
, from Tainan, Taiwan, ♂ (CW 4.4 mm), NCHUZOOL 14772 (A, B, D); ♀ (CW 5.6 mm), NCHUZOOL 14772 (C).
Macrophthalmus ( Mareotis ) purpureocheir
sp. nov.
, paratype ♂ (CW 15.3 mm), NCHUZOOL 14756, from Taitung, Taiwan (E–H). A, C, E, dorsal view; B, F, G, ventral view; C, H, frontal view.
